intro: Hieracium holopleurophyllum, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, dry fruits called cypselae. Hieracium holopleurophyllum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including meadows and roadsides.
